p: Classically, infectious neonatal diarrhoea has been seen as a problem caused by single aetiological agents. However, with the development of molecular techniques, a growing number of evidences indicated that many agents can be found in the faeces of affected animals [ 19, 21]. The problem now is to distinguish which of those agents primary cause diarrhoea, which others act as secondary or associated agents and which of them are part of the enteric microbiome without involvement in the disease.
